Architecture.question: Explain the function of the ALU and Control Unit in a CPU.
Architecture.answer: The ALU performs arithmetic and logic operations; the Control Unit fetches, decodes and coordinates execution of instructions.

Architecture.question: Describe the steps of the Fetch-Execute cycle.
Architecture.answer:
Any four from:
The PC holds the address of the next instruction
The address is copied to the MAR
The address is sent along the address bus
The instruction is fetched from that address in memory
... and transferred to the MDR
The instruction is sent to the CIR
The PC is incremented
The instruction is decoded and executed

Architecture.question: Explain how clock speed and cache size affect CPU performance.
Architecture.answer:
Clock speed: Higher speed means more cycles per second, so more instructions can be processed.
Cache size: Larger cache stores more frequently used instructions/data closer to the CPU, reducing access time compared to RAM.

Memory.question: Compare RAM and ROM with one use case for each.
Memory.answer: RAM is volatile working memory used during program execution. ROM is non-volatile and stores firmware that runs at start-up.

Memory.question: Explain the purpose of Virtual Memory.
Memory.answer:
Any three from:
It is used when RAM is full
Data not currently in use is moved from RAM to secondary storage (HDD/SSD)
... creating 'pages'
It extends the available memory for running programs
Data is swapped back to RAM when needed

I/O.question: Give one example each of an input device, output device and sensor.
I/O.answer: Input: keyboard; Output: monitor; Sensor: temperature sensor.

I/O.question: A greenhouse system controls temperature automatically. Describe how the system uses sensors and actuators to maintain temperature.
I/O.answer:
Any four from:
The temperature sensor constantly measures the temperature
It sends analogue data to the ADC
... which converts it to digital data for the microprocessor
The microprocessor compares the reading to a pre-set value
If temperature < pre-set value, it signals the actuator
... to turn on the heater
If temperature > pre-set value, it signals the actuator to turn off the heater/open windows

Systems.question: Define embedded system and give an example.
Systems.answer: An embedded system is dedicated to a specific function within a larger system, e.g., a washing machine controller.
